rComments: I spent a while trying to figure out why I like this class so much. What is MacGregor doing that makes Tax Law so engaging? The answer is when you ask a question, he sets you up with all the information to answer the question yourself, and then he pauses, and lets you answer it. He lets you have the "Ohhhhh moment," and you feel like a genius

Prof MacGregor is excellent at his job. I took Tax because it sounded useful, but I expected it to be as fun as eating cardboard. But surprisingly, he made it engaging and interesting. MacGregor goes the extra mile answering questions. He clearly loves teaching. Course is socratic method based (participation optional), no assignments, 100% final.

Awesome prof. Had him for securities, bizorg and tax. Somewhat socratic, but very fair. He often chooses students to read a case and do presentations about the case instead of him lecture, then engages with the class about the case. Interesting and entertaining lectures. You're really missing out if you don't get a class with him at Ottawa Law
Prof MacGregor is great. He explains complicated materials clearly and is very respectful towards his students.

I know there's no one teaching style for everyone but, in my humble opinion, MacGregor is the best lecturer at the law faculty. He's an engaging speaker, moves at a good pace, makes sure you understand complex topics before moving on, and is just a kind person in general. His material perfectly balances theory and practice.

You will learn a lot in his class if you keep up with the readings. He does not use notes or power-point, so it can be tough to follow which sections of the Income Tax Act he is discussing if you have not done the readings. Tough but fair grader. Very approachable in person, so ask questions during or after class if you need clarification.
